question: List all the different temperatures that a user has cooked onions. List them with date, temp, and outcome if available.

evidence.excerpt: making a sweet hollandaise sauce. The first video is me putting the caramelized onions and egg yolks for a little bit of honey in a jar. And then the second video was me putting that jar in a water bath at 140 something degrees at 141°

events.outcome: burning slowed; heat more evenly distributed

evidence.excerpt: i’ve added some keri gold butter and water probably about 2 tablespoons on the first round and then I just did it again I think the first round was about a half an hour ago but I’m not sure. I think it helped slow some of the burning and more evenly distributed some of the heat temperatures are still around 229° when I checked it and it could’ve been that way for up to a half an hour around then

events.temperature: low to medium heat; steam and light sizzling; lid on

evidence.excerpt: checking the temperature of the onions after the after they’ve been cooking with the lid on. There’s some steam and a little bit of sizzling but not quite translucent at all
I had I put the jar of egg and sous vide egg yolk and caramelized onion in the refrigerator overnight. This had been in a sous vide circulator at about 140.5° for maybe 4 to 5 hours.

events.outcome: reheating in sous vide bath; final state not stated

evidence.excerpt: A refrigerated overnight and I’m reheating it in a sous vide bath at around 105° because I was already making some yogurt

events.outcome: onions starting to become a little translucent and they have shrunk slightly; lid removed

evidence.excerpt: cooking at about 182 degrees onions are starting to become a little translucent and I think they have shrunk just a little bit. I removed the pot lid

I took a little bit of a break cause I had to step away from the stove. The onions have become much more brown at times they were cooking at about 210° but then I turned the heat down on average it’s been around 180° I don’t know how much time it’s been cooking for though I think less than two total hours

events.outcome: average around 180°F; cooking duration likely under two total hours

evidence.excerpt: I took a little bit of a break cause I had to step away from the stove. The onions have become much more brown at times they were cooking at about 210° but then I turned the heat down on average it’s been around 180° I don’t know how much time it’s been cooking for though I think less than two total hours

events.outcome: heat started low; browning began as heat rose toward 270°F; some translucent pieces

evidence.excerpt: I stepped away from the pan because it was on low and it was around and I think it was maybe around 165° so then I turned up the heat a little bit from maybe like 2 to 4 on the dial and I stepped away from the pan  and I got real hot real quick and it started to go up to like 270 or somewhere in the 270° range and as you can see there’s significant browning in some of the pieces and still translucent and not very brown in some of the larger pieces

events.outcome: onions significantly browned; some pieces still translucent; not very brown in larger pieces

evidence.excerpt: I stepped away from the pan because it was on low and it was around and I think it was maybe around 165° so then I turned up the heat a little bit from maybe like 2 to 4 on the dial and I stepped away from the pan  and I got real hot real quick and it started to go up to like 270 or somewhere in the 270° range and as you can see there’s significant browning in some of the pieces and still translucent and not very brown in some of the larger pieces
